questions.question: Which data structure is used to implement BFS?

explanations.b: BFS uses a queue to explore nodes level by level.

questions.question:
Consider the graph:

1 -- 2 -- 4
|    |
3 -- 5

If BFS starts at node 1, what is the order of traversal?

explanations.c: Start at 1, enqueue neighbors [2,3], visit 2 → enqueue 4,5, then visit 3 and 5, then 4.

questions.question: BFS can be used to determine:

answers.a: Shortest path in an unweighted graph
answers.b: Cycle detection in a directed graph

explanations.a: BFS explores nodes level-wise, which is ideal for shortest path in unweighted graphs.

questions.question: In BFS, which of the following statements is true?

answers.a: It may visit a node multiple times
answers.b: It always uses DFS stack internally
answers.c: It visits all neighbors of a node before moving deeper
answers.d: It is not suitable for finding shortest paths

explanations.c: BFS explores all neighbors first before going deeper into the graph.

questions.question:
Consider the following weighted graph (all edges have weight 1) and start BFS at node A:

A -- B -- D
|
C -- E

What is the BFS traversal order?

explanations.a: Start at A → enqueue neighbors [B,C] → visit B → enqueue D → visit C → enqueue E → visit D → visit E.

questions.question: Which of the following BFS applications is incorrect?

answers.b: Finding shortest path in an unweighted graph
